alert.note: Alert for Central Somerset; Coastal Waldo; Interior Waldo; Kennebec; Knox; Lincoln; Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford; Southern Franklin; Southern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 27 at 11:00PM EST until March 01 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...LOW PRESSURE TO BRING ACCUMULATING SNOW TO THE REGION THROUGH TUESDAY... .An area of low pressure is expected to move from the Great Lakes TO New England overnight into Tuesday before pulling away from the region Tuesday night. Snow is expected to overspread the region from the late Monday evening into the nighttime hours and continue through the day on Tuesday before tapering off Tuesday night. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TUESDAY TO 5 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph. * WHERE...Portions of south central, west central, and western Maine. Portions of northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...From 7 AM Tuesday to 5 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Periods of moderate snow will combine with low visibility to create hazardous driving conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
